page.title: 04SPRINGBURN FISH FARM
page.content: Springburn fishfarm is owned by one man who runs it by himself but sometimes gets help from a schoolboy. The farm was started in 1981. The fish eggs come from Denmark because they are the best.About 25,000 eggs were hatched this year.In the hatchery 150 litres of water per minute are used from a spring with the temperature always at 6* Celcius.The eggs usually hatch in May.The eggs are transported from Denmark to Glasgow by air. The fish produced are rainbow,brown and sea trout which are fed on pellets of soya with added vitimins.There are approximately 50,000 fish altogether. The preditors are herons,gulls and a young osprey. The water for the farm comes from the Black Burn.About 350 litres per minute are used.
